I did a fresh update of HEAD and I'm seeing the same problem. Create a C cygwin project using the wizard and create a main.c. Double click on main.c in the C/C++ Projects view and I get the same error dialog reported in this bug.

The preference name for the CodeReaderCache size isn't prefixed with the CDT namespace.  It can easily be fixed by adding the CDT namespace to the preference:

### Eclipse Workspace Patch 1.0
#P org.eclipse.cdt.core
Index: src/org/eclipse/cdt/core/parser/CodeReaderCache.java
===================================================================
RCS file: /cvsroot/tools/org.eclipse.cdt/all/org.eclipse.cdt.core/src/org/eclipse/cdt/core/parser/CodeReaderCache.java,v
retrieving revision 1.6
diff -u -r1.6 CodeReaderCache.java
--- src/org/eclipse/cdt/core/parser/CodeReaderCache.java	18 Jul 2005 14:40:00 -0000	1.6
+++ src/org/eclipse/cdt/core/parser/CodeReaderCache.java	9 Apr 2007 14:04:15 -0000
@@ -13,6 +13,7 @@
 
 import java.io.File;
 
+import org.eclipse.cdt.core.CCorePlugin;
 import org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.ast.EmptyIterator;
 import org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.util.ILRUCacheable;
 import org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.util.LRUCache;
@@ -39,7 +40,7 @@
 	/**
 	 * The string used to identify this CodeReaderCache.  Mainly used for preferences.
 	 */
-	public static final String CODE_READER_BUFFER="CODE_READER_CACHE"; //$NON-NLS-1$
+	public static final String CODE_READER_BUFFER = CCorePlugin.PLUGIN_ID + ".codeReaderCache"; //$NON-NLS-1$
 	
 	/**
 	 * The default size of the cache in MB.

Created an attachment (id=63261)
Proposed patch
